messages.message: Hey, first time i’ve seen this today. Are we actually busy? Seems unlikely being that its a Bank Holiday in the UK/EU and too early for the US to be using the platform
Note that everything has still been working fine.
I think this is our own rate limiting getting triggered cc @Ashwin do you know what’s going on here?
Is this aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com) @Lee?

Youre correct @Kerry this is our rate limiting

We have a max threshold of 100 concurrent inference requests while in build mode, and seeing multiple instances where you go over that @Lee

Does your app have over 100 fields? IIRC each field is inferred concurrently and we initially had a frontend limit of 50 or so and doubled it for the backend
Yep this is on prod @Ashwin. No my projects were very simple 4-5 fields per project.
I did have 5-7 samples per class. And my some fields have a clean prompt.

The projects i’ve been working on are all here - pretty basic projects

https://aihub.instabase.com/hub?workspace=aihub-templates
Could you open your network tab while youre running this and see how many requests are being made?
Also are you still facing this?
I’m not currently working on them as they are finished. But I can do so next time.
It happened quite a lot, I saw it maybe 10 times and just clicked close
I did notice the actions still succeeded, are we auto retrying?
were you working on multiple projects in multiple tabs at the same time?
yeah when it happens next time we can check the network tab
Nope just 1 project per time.
I did have the table of results open though.

hmm @lydia @Eric Han :point_up: not sure who works on table of result, maybe its because of the parallel requests for each files if the user has lots of files, it exceeds 100 (or build has to queue the requests somehow)

we can also bump the rate limit if Build now requires more concurrent requests after all the new features

So my project has 20 files and sometimes i’d edit the prompts in table view. I could sometimes run the clean function on its own, see some of the results and see its not right and then change the clean function and then click run all. Sometimes i’d then change it again before all the results for all documents had come back as i’d see id made the result worse.

I guess in this scenario I could get more than 100 jobs running at once.
I gues its possible i’d sometimes edit one field and as the results are coming back edit another one at the same time.
@Arjun for how we make requests from the results table.

Hmm we don't have any special logic in the results table for making requests. we'd need to add some queuing logic into how we call extraction. Cc @CJ because we've been talking about batching extraction across documents too
